p: Candida albicans is the most commonly isolated fungal pathogen globally and is associated with significant morbidity and mortality, particularly in patients with HIV or tuberculosis (TB) infection [ 114]. A recent paper demonstrated the cloning of antibody genes from B cell cultures derived from patients infected with C. albicans [ 115]. These antibodies were capable of stimulating opsonophagocytic macrophage activity and provided protection in a murine model of disseminated candidiasis.
